data.title: Warren Beatty
data.meta_description: Posts about Warren Beatty written by dcpfilm
data.text:
This is my year of watching long films, and this one was dedicated to two notorious flops that I’ve never seen before. They live up to their respective reputations. Michael Cimino’s Heaven’s Gate has been well-documented. Alongside the overlong run … Continue reading →

Warren Beatty double feature! It recently occurred to me that Beatty was in so few films that I might as well try to watch them all. Lilith is Beatty’s fourth film and Rossen’s last one. It’s a bit of a potboiler … Continue reading →

Quarantine has been good for revisiting classics, both new and old. Here are some scattered thoughts on a handful of those films. McCabe and Mrs. Miller McCabe and Mrs. Miller is surely one of the best films ever made. There is … Continue reading →

Jacques Demy’s debut feature – an homage to Max Ophuls, and a film that RW Fassbinder must have seen – is sharp and very much of the time. Lola (Anouk Aimee, just after La Dolce Vita) is a love-lorn cabaret dancer, … Continue reading →

I tend to do this every few months to catch up on the stated purpose of the blog: to write about everything I see. Over the last year I’ve seen that my trend in blogging has been towards blocking. That’s … Continue reading →

Shampoo is a lesser Hal Ashby, not on par with his other great ’70s film. Often accused of misogyny (I’ve read that Julie Christie had some huge reservations about being in the film; it does seem a bit anomalous for her), … Continue reading →
